thread.title: Jobsworth wardens fine driver £100 for leaving 4x4 inches out of bay in near-empty car park - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Jobsworth wardens fine driver £100 for leaving 4x4 inches out of bay in near-empty car park - Mirror Online

author: Simon Gilbert
title: Jobsworth wardens fine driver £100 for leaving 4x4 inches out of bay in near-empty car park - Mirror Online
text:
John Fannon's car was left just inches over the line (Photo: Coventry Telegraph) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jobsworth parking wardens stung a man with a £100 fine after he left his with car just inches out of the marked bay in a near-empty car park 
John Fannon, 40, was furious after receiving the ticket while spending just 30 minutes shopping with his family in Coventry. 
He was penalised despite there being a row of empty spaces next to his 4x4 in Arena Park Shopping Centre . 
The ticket left by Park Watch wardens on Tuesday last week complained the Mitsubishi Outlander was 'not parked wholly within bay'. John Fannon is planning to appeal the ticket (Photo: Coventry Telegraph) 
But Mr Fannon, from Market Harborough, Leicestershire, said: "We plan to appeal the ticket if we can’t get it sorted out any other way. 
“My initial reaction was disbelief. I thought ‘what have I done wrong?’ We have never had a problem there before. 
“If we had parked way out of the space when it was busy, it might have been a reason to give a ticket. But the entire row was empty, it doesn’t make sense, it’s silly. 
“The level of the fine doesn’t match the misdemeanour." Read More Feel you've been hard done by over a parking ticket? This life hack could save you hundreds The 4x4 was left for just 30 minutes in a near-empty car park (Photo: Coventry Telegraph) 
The IT worker added: “There are apparently 150 signs in the car park, but you can’t see any in the photos I’ve taken, they’re obviously positioned in the wrong place. 
“The experience has definitely put me off going back, we won’t be returning if they’re going to be silly about parking.” 
Mr Fannon accepted his vehicle was left marginally outside of the lines while his family shopped in sports store Decathlon. Read More Your AA breakdown cover could be about to rise - as firm warns it's struggling to manage insurance tax hikes 
But he insisted he needed room to allow his son and daughter to climb out of the 4x4. 
He told the Coventry Telegraph : “It was starting to rain, so we parked our car on the end of the row closest to the store, but left room to enable our young children to get out as the space was next to the steel bollards. 
“We spent approximately 20 to 30 minutes in store and eventually purchased some football boots and other items for our daughter.” The wardens complained the car was 'not parked wholly within' the bay (Photo: Coventry Telegraph) 
He added: “I have contacted Decathlon Coventry and the store manager has responded stating that they cannot have the charge cancelled, despite the clear evidence above and the fact that we have long been happy Decathlon customers.” 
Mr Fannon said he wanted to make other drivers aware of the issue to stop them being caught out. 
The Mirror has approached Park Watch for comment. Like us on Facebook
